page.title: 17CHARLTON-HANK.FARMING 3
page.content: {Grass.}The area is predominantly grassland used for grazing and the making of silage and hay for Winter fodder.Two thirds of the mown grass is made into silage,some in clamps,a lesser amount into large round bales weighing 1/2 ton,the other third being made into hay mostly for young calves. {Dairy.}Seven dairy farms milk Friesian cows and one milks a herd of Guernseys.The average herd is 100 head with followers.All milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board for liquid consumption (door-step delivery) Very little is used for cheese and butter-making.All farms have milk quotas limiting the amount of milk produced.The National quota is 12,500,000,000 litres.Average milk price to farmers is 15p per litre. Newly calved Friesian heifers sell for Â£600 each and Guernseys for Â£450 each.
